name: fireweed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of various plants, especially rosebay willowherb, that are the first plants to appear after a fire, with narrow leaves and pink or purple flowers: Fireweed grows best on burned-over land or disturbed soil. Summer was ending, and the purple fireweed had finished blooming.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bees feasted on nectar from the abundant fireweed popping up in the areas of new growth.A richly-coloured blanket of fireweed, alder, and berries still covered the hillside.The weather and conditions were ideal for fireweed to produce nectar.
